newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares end up, fuelled by market rumours.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares end up, fuelled by market rumours.

text.p: Market rumours pushed Singapore shares to a firm close on Friday, but volume was modest.

The 30-share Straits Times Industrials Index climbed 18.79 points to 2,181.79 after a Wall Street overnight gain of 43.65 points. Market volume was a moderate 99.48 million shares with advances ahead of decliners by 180 to 128.
Retailer Metro Holdings surged to an intraday high of Singapore $6.20 before closingat a year high of S$6.05, up S$1.55, with 6.72 million shares traded.
Dealers said this sparked off renewed retail interest in shares surrounded by rumours, like Causeway Investment and Malaysia's Tan Chong Motor, which were among the top actives.
Causeway Investment, seen as a possible separate listing on the Malaysian over-the-counter market when it materialises, was unchanged at S$1.46 on a turnover of 1.72 million shares.
Tan Chong Motor, whose Singapore branch was seen as a possible separate listing on Singapore's second board, fell three cents to S$2.66 on a volume of 1.77 million shares.
